textField: One possible method to improve the ability of a neural machine translation system to translate *unseen* words, that is words not present in the *training* corpus is the use of a technique called *byte pair encoding*. In this technique, words are divided in *subword units* which may or may not make linguistic sense. The output neurons in the decoder do not compute *an embedding vector* but rather *the likelihood* of each possible such unit in the target *vocabulary*. While one could select just the most likely one, a procedure called *beam search* considers more than one option in each position and keeps track of the most promising output sequences.
